alert.note: Alert for Southern Blue Mountains of Oregon (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 10 at 2:50PM PST until January 14 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THURSDAY TO 4 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the first Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 6 inches. For the second Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 16 to 32 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Southern Blue Mountains of Oregon. * WHEN...For the first Winter Storm Warning, until 10 PM PST this evening. For the second Winter Storm Warning, from 10 AM Thursday to 4 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained for Oregon by calling 5 1 1 or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com, or for Washington by visiting online at https://wsdot.com/travel.
